## Description {#details}

This contains a <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machineschedstrategy">MachineSchedStrategy</a> implementation for maximizing wave occupancy on GCN hardware.

This pass will apply multiple scheduling stages to the same function. Regions are first recorded in <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnscheduledagmilive/#a3c1701146006f98eaa57e38932060160">GCNScheduleDAGMILive::schedule</a>. The actual entry point for the scheduling of those regions is GCNScheduleDAGMILive::runSchedStages.

<SectionDefinition>

## Functions

### canUsePressureDiffs() {#aba393b0035b052e3477fc32a72643750}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>static bool canUsePressureDiffs (<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/aarch64/aarch64promoteconstant-cpp/#a90f8350fecae261c25be85d38b451bff">const</a> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> &amp; SU)</>}
  labels = {["static"]}>
Checks whether <code>SU</code> can use the cached DAG pressure diffs to compute the current register pressure.

This works for the common case, but it has a few exceptions that have been observed through trial and error:
<ul>
<li>Explicit physical register operands</li>
<li>Subregister definitions</li>
</ul>


In both of those cases, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pressurediff">PressureDiff</a> doesn&#39;t represent the actual pressure, and querying <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/liveintervals">LiveIntervals</a> through the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/regpressuretracker">RegPressureTracker</a> is needed to get an accurate value.

We should eventually only use <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pressurediff">PressureDiff</a> for maximum performance, but this already allows 80% of SUs to take the fast path without changing scheduling at all. Further changes would either change scheduling, or require a lot more logic to recover an accurate pressure estimate from the <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pressurediffs">PressureDiffs</a>.

Definition at line <a href="#l00141">141</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcnschedstrategy-cpp">GCNSchedStrategy.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

## Defines

### DEBUG&#95;TYPE {#ad78e062f62e0d6e453941fb4ca843e4d}

<MemberDefinition
  prototype={<>#define DEBUG&#95;TYPE&nbsp;&nbsp;&nbsp;&quot;machine-scheduler&quot;</>}>
Generally, the reason for having multiple scheduling stages is to account for the kernel-wide effect of register usage on occupancy.

Usually, only a few scheduling regions will have register pressure high enough to limit occupancy for the kernel, so constraints can be relaxed to improve ILP in other regions.

Definition at line <a href="#l00031">31</a> of file <a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/amdgpu/gcnschedstrategy-cpp">GCNSchedStrategy.cpp</a>.
</MemberDefinition>

</SectionDefinition>

<Link id="l00086" /><CodeLine lineNumber="86"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Set the initial TargetOccupnacy to the maximum occupancy that we can</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00087" /><CodeLine lineNumber="87"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// achieve for this function. This effectively sets a lower bound on the</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00099" /><CodeLine lineNumber="99"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125; </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">else</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00100" /><CodeLine lineNumber="100"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is similar to ST.getMaxNumVGPRs(TargetOccupancy) result except</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00101" /><CodeLine lineNumber="101"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// returns a reasonably small number for targets with lots of VGPRs, such</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00103" /><CodeLine lineNumber="103"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/debug-h/#a196897517069dda1bdb549e24468f7d7">LLVM&#95;DEBUG</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7c46c742c31be54870e2038048e6b391">dbgs</a>() &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;Region is known to spill, use alternative &quot;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00104" /><CodeLine lineNumber="104"><span class="doxyHighlight">                         </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;VGPRCriticalLimit calculation method.\\n&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00105" /><CodeLine lineNumber="105"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00106" /><CodeLine lineNumber="106"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Granule = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/amdgpu/isainfo/#ae47a2723f63ec4e85b4228b56e5d759c">AMDGPU::IsaInfo::getVGPRAllocGranule</a>(&amp;ST);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00107" /><CodeLine lineNumber="107"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> Addressable = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/amdgpu/isainfo/#a842a99d2928e264423f0ac73b0910ec9">AMDGPU::IsaInfo::getAddressableNumVGPRs</a>(&amp;ST);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00108" /><CodeLine lineNumber="108"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> VGPRBudget = <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a41896492f62ee8d25cf8aaad70bd88aa">alignDown</a>(Addressable / <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#a45c6b23ba1bf5916572a93ef35d962c5">TargetOccupancy</a>, Granule);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00109" /><CodeLine lineNumber="109"><span class="doxyHighlight">    VGPRBudget = std::max(VGPRBudget, Granule);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00110" /><CodeLine lineNumber="110"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#a87648a3c33abb5fb8ff110b760424ecc">VGPRCriticalLimit</a> = std::min(VGPRBudget, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#a54479ded7088e7b425de5d6c1f77fb7a">VGPRExcessLimit</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00111" /><CodeLine lineNumber="111"><span class="doxyHighlight">  &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00112" /><CodeLine lineNumber="112"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00113" /><CodeLine lineNumber="113"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Subtract error margin and bias from register limits and avoid overflow.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00114" /><CodeLine lineNumber="114"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#a2ed3b8acc5fc8c2f5c155620b5c32555">SGPRCriticalLimit</a> -= std::min(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#aa5bfab3502e3953ac33f90ae4c86fecc">SGPRLimitBias</a> + <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#aca0e645faeaad83ce440e96cc39b6763">ErrorMargin</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#a2ed3b8acc5fc8c2f5c155620b5c32555">SGPRCriticalLimit</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00115" /><CodeLine lineNumber="115"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#a87648a3c33abb5fb8ff110b760424ecc">VGPRCriticalLimit</a> -= std::min(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#af100c4ee35e4de0856b35b151479ec3d">VGPRLimitBias</a> + <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#aca0e645faeaad83ce440e96cc39b6763">ErrorMargin</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#a87648a3c33abb5fb8ff110b760424ecc">VGPRCriticalLimit</a>);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00117" /><CodeLine lineNumber="117"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#a54479ded7088e7b425de5d6c1f77fb7a">VGPRExcessLimit</a> -= std::min(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#af100c4ee35e4de0856b35b151479ec3d">VGPRLimitBias</a> + <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#aca0e645faeaad83ce440e96cc39b6763">ErrorMargin</a>, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#a54479ded7088e7b425de5d6c1f77fb7a">VGPRExcessLimit</a>);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00118" /><CodeLine lineNumber="118"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00119" /><CodeLine lineNumber="119"><span class="doxyHighlight">  <a href="/docs/api/files/include/include/llvm/include/llvm/support/debug-h/#a196897517069dda1bdb549e24468f7d7">LLVM&#95;DEBUG</a>(<a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#a7c46c742c31be54870e2038048e6b391">dbgs</a>() &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;VGPRCriticalLimit = &quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#a87648a3c33abb5fb8ff110b760424ecc">VGPRCriticalLimit</a></span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00120" /><CodeLine lineNumber="120"><span class="doxyHighlight">                    &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;, VGPRExcessLimit = &quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#a54479ded7088e7b425de5d6c1f77fb7a">VGPRExcessLimit</a></span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00121" /><CodeLine lineNumber="121"><span class="doxyHighlight">                    &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;, SGPRCriticalLimit = &quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#a2ed3b8acc5fc8c2f5c155620b5c32555">SGPRCriticalLimit</a></span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00122" /><CodeLine lineNumber="122"><span class="doxyHighlight">                    &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;, SGPRExcessLimit = &quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &lt;&lt; <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#aa8793c7d097d298c1590b67980054d8b">SGPRExcessLimit</a> &lt;&lt; </span><span class="doxyHighlightStringLiteral">&quot;\\n\\n&quot;</span><span class="doxyHighlight">);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00123" /><CodeLine lineNumber="123"><span class="doxyHighlight">&#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00124" /><CodeLine lineNumber="124"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00125" /><CodeLine lineNumber="125"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// Checks whether \\p SU can use the cached DAG pressure diffs to compute the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00126" /><CodeLine lineNumber="126"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// current register pressure.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00127" /><CodeLine lineNumber="127"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00128" /><CodeLine lineNumber="128"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// This works for the common case, but it has a few exceptions that have been</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00129" /><CodeLine lineNumber="129"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// observed through trial and error:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00130" /><CodeLine lineNumber="130"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - Explicit physical register operands</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00131" /><CodeLine lineNumber="131"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///   - Subregister definitions</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00132" /><CodeLine lineNumber="132"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00133" /><CodeLine lineNumber="133"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// In both of those cases, PressureDiff doesn&#39;t represent the actual pressure,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00134" /><CodeLine lineNumber="134"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// and querying LiveIntervals through the RegPressureTracker is needed to get</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00135" /><CodeLine lineNumber="135"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// an accurate value.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00136" /><CodeLine lineNumber="136"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00137" /><CodeLine lineNumber="137"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// We should eventually only use PressureDiff for maximum performance, but this</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00138" /><CodeLine lineNumber="138"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// already allows 80% of SUs to take the fast path without changing scheduling</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00139" /><CodeLine lineNumber="139"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// at all. Further changes would either change scheduling, or require a lot</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00140" /><CodeLine lineNumber="140"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// more logic to recover an accurate pressure estimate from the PressureDiffs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00141" /><CodeLine lineNumber="141" lineLink="#aba393b0035b052e3477fc32a72643750"><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">static</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="#aba393b0035b052e3477fc32a72643750">canUsePressureDiffs</a>(</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/sunit">SUnit</a> &amp;SU) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00143" /><CodeLine lineNumber="143"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">false</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00211" /><CodeLine lineNumber="211"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00212" /><CodeLine lineNumber="212"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We try to use the cached PressureDiffs in the ScheduleDAG whenever</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00213" /><CodeLine lineNumber="213"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// possible over querying the RegPressureTracker.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00214" /><CodeLine lineNumber="214"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00215" /><CodeLine lineNumber="215"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// RegPressureTracker will make a lot of LIS queries which are very</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00216" /><CodeLine lineNumber="216"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// expensive, it is considered a slow function in this context.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00218" /><CodeLine lineNumber="218"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// PressureDiffs are precomputed and cached, and getPressureDiff is just a</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00219" /><CodeLine lineNumber="219"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// trivial lookup into an array. It is pretty much free.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00235" /><CodeLine lineNumber="235"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// PressureDiffs is always bottom-up so if we&#39;re working top-down we need</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00236" /><CodeLine lineNumber="236"><span class="doxyHighlight">      </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to invert its sign.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00237" /><CodeLine lineNumber="237"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#ab169c359dc2328b0a4e93f5f95b82fc0">Pressure</a>&#91;Diff.getPSet()&#93; +=</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00239" /><CodeLine lineNumber="239"><span class="doxyHighlight">    &#125;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00240" /><CodeLine lineNumber="240"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00261" /><CodeLine lineNumber="261"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00262" /><CodeLine lineNumber="262"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NewSGPRPressure = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#ab169c359dc2328b0a4e93f5f95b82fc0">Pressure</a>&#91;AMDGPU::RegisterPressureSets::SReg&#95;32&#93;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00263" /><CodeLine lineNumber="263"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NewVGPRPressure = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#ab169c359dc2328b0a4e93f5f95b82fc0">Pressure</a>&#91;AMDGPU::RegisterPressureSets::VGPR&#95;32&#93;;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00264" /><CodeLine lineNumber="264"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00265" /><CodeLine lineNumber="265"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If two instructions increase the pressure of different register sets</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00266" /><CodeLine lineNumber="266"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// by the same amount, the generic scheduler will prefer to schedule the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00267" /><CodeLine lineNumber="267"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// instruction that increases the set with the least amount of registers,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00268" /><CodeLine lineNumber="268"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// which in our case would be SGPRs.  This is rarely what we want, so</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00269" /><CodeLine lineNumber="269"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// when we report excess/critical register pressure, we do it either</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00270" /><CodeLine lineNumber="270"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// only for VGPRs or only for SGPRs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00271" /><CodeLine lineNumber="271"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00272" /><CodeLine lineNumber="272"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// FIXME: Better heuristics to determine whether to prefer SGPRs or VGPRs.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00273" /><CodeLine lineNumber="273"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MaxVGPRPressureInc = 16;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="274"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ShouldTrackVGPRs = VGPRPressure + MaxVGPRPressureInc &gt;= <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#a54479ded7088e7b425de5d6c1f77fb7a">VGPRExcessLimit</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="275"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> ShouldTrackSGPRs = !ShouldTrackVGPRs &amp;&amp; SGPRPressure &gt;= <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#aa8793c7d097d298c1590b67980054d8b">SGPRExcessLimit</a>;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00276" /><CodeLine lineNumber="276"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00277" /><CodeLine lineNumber="277"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// FIXME: We have to enter REG-EXCESS before we reach the actual threshold</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00278" /><CodeLine lineNumber="278"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// to increase the likelihood we don&#39;t go over the limits.  We should improve</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="279"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the analysis to look through dependencies to find the path with the least</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00280" /><CodeLine lineNumber="280"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// register pressure.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00281" /><CodeLine lineNumber="281"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="282"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We only need to update the RPDelta for instructions that increase register</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="283"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// pressure. Instructions that decrease or keep reg pressure the same will be</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00284" /><CodeLine lineNumber="284"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// marked as RegExcess in tryCandidate() when they are compared with</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00285" /><CodeLine lineNumber="285"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// instructions that increase the register pressure.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00286" /><CodeLine lineNumber="286"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (ShouldTrackVGPRs &amp;&amp; NewVGPRPressure &gt;= <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#a54479ded7088e7b425de5d6c1f77fb7a">VGPRExcessLimit</a>) &#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="287"><span class="doxyHighlight">    <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#a1902cf3722582eecec1d87862513ba3b">HasHighPressure</a> = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="288"><span class="doxyHighlight">    Cand.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/genericschedulerbase/schedcandidate/#a81fbfdac1b8c1e736493b56b50853322">RPDelta</a>.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/regpressuredelta/#aff9c3b403c6d4af795dd8be1c9612240">Excess</a> = <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/pressurechange">PressureChange</a>(AMDGPU::RegisterPressureSets::VGPR&#95;32);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00298" /><CodeLine lineNumber="298"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Register pressure is considered &#39;CRITICAL&#39; if it is approaching a value</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00299" /><CodeLine lineNumber="299"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// that would reduce the wave occupancy for the execution unit.  When</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00300" /><CodeLine lineNumber="300"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// register pressure is &#39;CRITICAL&#39;, increasing SGPR and VGPR pressure both</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00301" /><CodeLine lineNumber="301"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// has the same cost, so we don&#39;t need to prefer one over the other.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00302" /><CodeLine lineNumber="302"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00303" /><CodeLine lineNumber="303"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">int</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> SGPRDelta = NewSGPRPressure - <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstrategy/#a2ed3b8acc5fc8c2f5c155620b5c32555">SGPRCriticalLimit</a>;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00305" /><CodeLine lineNumber="305"></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00588" /><CodeLine lineNumber="588"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// optimizations which may reduce resource requirements.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00589" /><CodeLine lineNumber="589"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00590" /><CodeLine lineNumber="590"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// This is a best effort to set things up for a post-RA pass. Optimizations</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00591" /><CodeLine lineNumber="591"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// like generating loads of multiple registers should ideally be done within</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00592" /><CodeLine lineNumber="592"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// the scheduler pass by combining the loads during DAG postprocessing.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00629" /><CodeLine lineNumber="629"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00630" /><CodeLine lineNumber="630"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// GCNMaxMemoryClauseSchedStrategy tries best to clause memory instructions as</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00631" /><CodeLine lineNumber="631"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// much as possible. This is achieved by:</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00632" /><CodeLine lineNumber="632"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  1 Prioritize clustered operations before stall latency heuristic.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00633" /><CodeLine lineNumber="633"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">//  2 Prioritize long-latency-load before stall latency heuristic.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00634" /><CodeLine lineNumber="634"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00635" /><CodeLine lineNumber="635"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\param Cand provides the policy and current best candidate.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00636" /><CodeLine lineNumber="636"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\param TryCand refers to the next SUnit candidate, otherwise uninitialized.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00637" /><CodeLine lineNumber="637"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\param Zone describes the scheduled zone that we are extending, or nullptr</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00638" /><CodeLine lineNumber="638"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">///             if Cand is from a different zone than TryCand.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00639" /><CodeLine lineNumber="639"><span class="doxyHighlightComment">/// \\return \\c true if TryCand is better than Cand (Reason is NOT NoCand)</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00640" /><CodeLine lineNumber="640" lineLink="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnmaxmemoryclauseschedstrategy/#a9eba23f1b8a103c8e88a2ca6227d97b3"><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">bool</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnmaxmemoryclauseschedstrategy/#a9eba23f1b8a103c8e88a2ca6227d97b3">GCNMaxMemoryClauseSchedStrategy::tryCandidate</a>(<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/genericschedulerbase/schedcandidate">SchedCandidate</a> &amp;Cand,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00641" /><CodeLine lineNumber="641"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                                   <a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/genericschedulerbase/schedcandidate">SchedCandidate</a> &amp;TryCand,</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00642" /><CodeLine lineNumber="642"><span class="doxyHighlight">                                                   <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/schedboundary">SchedBoundary</a> &#42;Zone)</span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword"> const </span><span class="doxyHighlight">&#123;</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00643" /><CodeLine lineNumber="643"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Initialize the candidate if needed.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00644" /><CodeLine lineNumber="644"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">if</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> (!Cand.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/genericschedulerbase/schedcandidate/#acdc733638a93dca6bb0eb290ec896271">isValid</a>()) &#123;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00646" /><CodeLine lineNumber="646"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordFlow">return</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">true</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00649" /><CodeLine lineNumber="649"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// Bias PhysReg Defs and copies to their uses and defined respectively.</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00651" /><CodeLine lineNumber="651"><span class="doxyHighlight">                 <a href="/docs/api/namespaces/llvm/#afb4b9423201406d79ba16481c90cb6cb">biasPhysReg</a>(Cand.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/genericschedulerbase/schedcandidate/#a310a170b7d2442d12634d53db262fb92">SU</a>, Cand.<a href="/docs/api/structs/llvm/genericschedulerbase/schedcandidate/#a87328c4ecbb87961dd2c970d343b9ca0">AtTop</a>), TryCand, Cand, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/genericschedulerbase/#ae0da1bc94e326020069c0f44170a48d3ab58c08e8fa9324ebf332e11601ec6c0d">PhysReg</a>))</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00817" /><CodeLine lineNumber="817"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00818" /><CodeLine lineNumber="818"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// If the block has the only successor then live-ins of that successor are</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00819" /><CodeLine lineNumber="819"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// live-outs of the current block. We can reuse calculated live set if the</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00820" /><CodeLine lineNumber="820"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// successor will be sent to scheduling past current block.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00821" /><CodeLine lineNumber="821"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00822" /><CodeLine lineNumber="822"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// However, due to the bug in LiveInterval analysis it may happen that two</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00823" /><CodeLine lineNumber="823"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// predecessors of the same successor block have different lane bitmasks for</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00824" /><CodeLine lineNumber="824"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// a live-out register. Workaround that by sticking to one-to-one relationship</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00825" /><CodeLine lineNumber="825"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// i.e. one predecessor with one successor block.</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l00826" /><CodeLine lineNumber="826"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">const</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> MachineBasicBlock &#42;OnlySucc = </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">nullptr</span><span class="doxyHighlight">;</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l00828" /><CodeLine lineNumber="828"><span class="doxyHighlight">    </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeyword">auto</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> &#42;Candidate = &#42;<a href="/docs/api/files/lib/lib/target/lib/target/arm/armslshardening-cpp/#a5958512eae2979bd2eb383977996a600">MBB</a>-&gt;<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/machinebasicblock/#a6321b189ea8fd5058663f8a87d6c23e9">succ&#95;begin</a>();</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01274" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1274"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> TargetOccupancy = std::min(</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01275" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1275"><span class="doxyHighlight">      <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstage/#a2f14a5fe09608fc5cce9e68e4f516a68">S</a>.getTargetOccupancy(), <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstage/#afce50f36ba47b66bbea271c232ac99e2">ST</a>.getOccupancyWithWorkGroupSizes(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstage/#a979d350534fac63dad98d8f2937bf5a7">MF</a>).second);</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01279" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1279"><span class="doxyHighlight">      std::min(TargetOccupancy, <a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstage/#a30bb50e213057f1830b72558972019fa">PressureBefore</a>.getOccupancy(<a href="/docs/api/classes/llvm/gcnschedstage/#afce50f36ba47b66bbea271c232ac99e2">ST</a>));</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01282" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1282"></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01283" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1283"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightComment">// We may not be able to keep the current target occupancy because of the just</span></CodeLine>

<Link id="l01287" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1287"><span class="doxyHighlight">  </span><span class="doxyHighlightKeywordType">unsigned</span><span class="doxyHighlight"> NewOccupancy = std::max(WavesAfter, WavesBefore);</span></CodeLine>
<Link id="l01288" /><CodeLine lineNumber="1288"></CodeLine>
